alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 9:04PM EST until December 20 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Penobscot and Piscataquis Counties. East Branch Penobscot River At Grindstone affecting Penobscot County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River Above Dover-Foxcroft affecting Piscataquis County. Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Penobscot River at West Enfield. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, River is out of banks in several areas with high flows. Residents along the river should prepare for flooding if additional rises are expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 17.8 feet. - River is currently at bankfull. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 18.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.0 feet on 09/30/1909. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 315 AM EST.
